meanings.sent1: My sister is such an extrovert, always making new friends.
meanings.sent2: The extrovert at the party was the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: The extrovert in our group convinced us to go on a spontaneous road trip.
meanings.sent4: Her personality shines like an extrovert in a crowded room.
meanings.sent5: Being an extrovert, he thrived in social gatherings.

meanings.definition: To direct one's interest outward or to things outside oneself.
meanings.sent1: I need to extrovert my focus from my worries to my goals.
meanings.sent2: She tends to extrovert her energy into her work projects.
meanings.sent3: Let's extrovert our creativity and come up with a unique solution.
meanings.sent4: He tried to extrovert his enthusiasm towards the new opportunity.
meanings.sent5: Extroverting his curiosity, he explored new hobbies.
